channel.title: frinj on Martin Trojer
channel.description: Recent content in frinj on Martin Trojer

item.title: Announcing Frins, a practical unit of measure calculator DSL for Scala
item.description: I am proud to announce a new Scala project called “Frins”. Frins is a practical unit-of-measure calculator DSL for Scala. Key features; Tracks units of measure through all calculations allowing you to mix units of measure transparently Comes with a huge database of units and conversion factors Inspired by the Frink project Full source code available on github. To wet your appetite head straight over to the example calculations. How Frins came about About a year ago I created Frinj.

item.title: Adding Live Unit Feeds to Frinj
item.description: A couple of weeks has passed since I’ve pushed Frinj to github and blogged/tweeted about it. The response have been pretty awesome, one highlight being when @stuarthalloway showed me a frinj+datomic example gist on the #datomic IRC channel. In short, the Clojure community is #badass. Frinj comes with a big database of units and conversion factors, andÂ while as many conversion factors are “eternal”, others aren’t. Exchange rates for instance has to be kept up to date to be relevant.

item.title: Announcing Frinj, a practical unit of measure calculator DSL for Clojure
item.description: I am proud to announce a new Clojure project called “Frinj”. Frinj is a practical unit-of-measure calculator DSL for Clojure. Key features; Tracks units of measure through all calculations allowing you to mix units of measure transparently Comes with a huge database of units and conversion factors Inspired by the Frink project Tries to combine Frink’s fluent calculation style with idiomatic Clojure Full source code available on github. To wet your apatite head straight over to the sample calculations page to see what Frinj can do!
